C I R C U L A R   NO.    24   / 2005 
 
 
 
It has come to notice that some Airport Directors/ Chief Airport Security Officers 
do not take up the matter in advance with local police/ Administration authorities for 
making law and order arrangement at the airport during a bandh or a protest march 
organized by some political, social or religious group or party. As a result, some 
untoward incidents, which could have been prevented, have happened in the recent past. 
In one incident at Indore airport, large number of protesters managed to enter 
unauthorisedly even into restricted areas of the airport. 
 
Unlawful gathering in front of the Terminal building and/ or unauthorized entry 
into security controlled and security restricted areas of the airport may lead to breach in 
security and thereby an act of unlawful interference with civil aviation operations at the 
airport. So, it is imperative to take all possible steps to prevent any such incident. 
 
In view of the above, all Airport Directors and Chief Airport Security Officers 
must review and strengthen security arrangement at the airport, and also liaise well in 
advance with local police/ administration authorities for making proper law and order 
arrangement during the bandh/ protest march etc. 
 
 
(R.C. Tayal) 
Commissioner of Security (CA)
